Articles.Content:
This is a real working gearbox. I made it as a part of my future car with ICE.

P.S. See my ICE http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92853-Internal-combustion-engine

It needs Infernal robotics and Ubiozur welding.

Download:

http://www./download/dcz3kj3yla5wecd/XXX-Gears-17.craft

http://www./download/4xx6rnad8zjpt6b/Structural78.rar

That thing is nuts. And I mean that in the best way possible.
So.. It's gonna be a car... You are crazy! I'm looking forward to see it:cool:

Ah, another mechanic! Great!

Why don't you take a look at my topic, maybe we can join forces!

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97042-WIP-Internal-Combustion-Engine-Construction-Kit-v0-2-Transmissions!

Ah, another mechanic! Great!

Why don't you take a look at my topic, maybe we can join forces!

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97042-WIP-Internal-Combustion-Engine-Construction-Kit-v0-2-Transmissions!

That thing you made is awesome! But, it's a mod. I want to build car without mods (only IR). It's not so interesting to use ICE mod to make ICE.

I see your point. But to build a car using stock parts could mean it will grow to the size of the VAB itself, and very heavy. I'm downsizing and that's a challenge by itself, with all the connections becoming more flexible the less mass the parts have. And welding doesn't work with Procedural Parts.

I'll keep an eye on your work, it's fascinating.

I see your point. But to build a car using stock parts could mean it will grow to the size of the VAB itself, and very heavy. I'm downsizing and that's a challenge by itself, with all the connections becoming more flexible the less mass the parts have. And welding doesn't work with Procedural Parts.

I'll keep an eye on your work, it's fascinating.

How about that?

No, You did not!

Reaction= (Ã‚Â°Ãâ€Ã‚Â°)

I really didn't. Not yet! My ICE, unfortunately, appeared to be not powerful enough. And there are some issues with the gearbox. They work just fine separately, but not together. So it's gonna take some time to make everything work. But it's 100% possible and only a question of time.

Very nice!

What is the mass of your car?

How about that?

http://i.imgur.com/w0Nd3M5.png

I think I just exploded, and in fright, so did my CPU, how many parts is that? And more importantly how long did it take you to build such a monster masterpiece?

I think he is going full Kerbal!

What are you using for bearings? I saw someone make very compact bearings for plane propellers, all stock.
Only in KSP where building gears is more complex than simply strapping on a rocket to run a car

Very compact AND reliable, all stock? Now that's something I'd like to see. The only reliable compact bearings I've seen are the IR station parts, which I modified into free runners. And yeah, I build crankshafts, props, turbines & helicopters with those.

I think he is going full Kerbal!

What are you using for bearings? I saw someone make very compact bearings for plane propellers, all stock.

I think he is going full Kerbal!

What are you using for bearings? I saw someone make very compact bearings for plane propellers, all stock.

At first I didn't use anything (only a hole made by plates). But now I use bearings (simple rings). I've made them myself.

About quantity of parts... I have no idea. I've started this project about 4 month ago, so I don't remember. And most of the parts are welded, so it's practically impossible to find out how many parts are there. But, it's around 3K.

Edited October 31, 2014 by KHTRE

Very compact AND reliable, all stock? Now that's something I'd like to see. The only reliable compact bearings I've seen are the IR station parts, which I modified into free runners. And yeah, I build crankshafts, props, turbines & helicopters with those.

I can't remember now. Somebody made some great WW2 bombers and the bearings were used for his props.
